str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To finish, complete, accomplish fully. From dia and anuo; to accomplish thoroughly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A voyage, sailing. From pleo; a sail, i.e. Navigation.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Tyre, an ancient city, the capital of Phoenicia. Of Hebrew origin: Tyrus, a place in Palestine.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From kata and a derivative of anti; to meet against, i.e. Arrive at.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Ptolemais, a coast city of Phoenicia, midway between Tyre and Caesarea. From Ptolemaios; Ptolemais, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
